data.meaning_mnemonic: On the <radical>ground</radical> you put <radical>barb</radical>s at the bottom of a <radical>slide</radical>. This is your special <kanji>talent</kanji>. When you go down the slide, you fly right past the barbs like some kind of daredevil. Any normal kid would land on the barbs and get hurt, but you have this talent.
data.meaning_hint: Imagine yourself placing the barbs in front of the slide, thinking about how talented you are. It took years of training to perfect this talent. But it was worth it. Everyone on the playground respects you now.
data.reading_mnemonic: But then people start to say that no human could have so much <kanji>talent</kanji>, that you must be a <reading>cy</reading>borg (さい). Are you really a talented cyborg?
data.reading_hint: Cyborgs have brain implants and cool bionic limbs, so they're basically the most talented people around.
